column2: Three Months Later
column3: Three Months Later

column2: The kangaroo still continues to grow, which is very strange and perplexing.
column3: The kangaroo still continues to grow, which is very strange and perplexing.

column2: I never knew one to be so long getting its growth. It has fur on its head now; not like kangaroo fur, but exactly like our hair, except that it is much finer and softer, and instead of being black is red.
column3: I never knew one to be so long getting its growth. It has fur on its head now; not like kangaroo fur, but exactly like our hair, except that it is much finer and softer, and instead of being black is red.

column2: I am like to lose my mind over the capricious and harassing developments of this unclassifiable zoological freak. If I could catch another one--but that is hopeless; it is a new variety, and the only sample; this is plain.
column3: I am like to lose my mind over the capricious and harassing developments of this unclassifiable zoological freak. If I could catch another one-but that is hopeless; it is a new variety, and the only sample; this is plain.

column2: But I caught a true kangaroo and brought it in, thinking that this one, being lonesome, would rather have that for company than have no kin at all, or any animal it could feel a nearness to or get sympathy from in its forlorn condition here among strangers who do not know its ways or habits, or what to do to make it feel that it is among friends; but it was a mistake--it went into such fits at the sight of the kangaroo that I was convinced it had never seen one before.
column3: But I caught a true kangaroo and brought it in, thinking that this one, being lonesome, would rather have that for company than have no kin at all, or any animal it could feel a nearness to or get sympathy from in its forlorn condition here among strangers who do not know its ways or habits, or what to do to make it feel that it is among friends; but it was a mistake-it went into such fits at the sight of the kangaroo that I was convinced it had never seen one before.

column2: I pity the poor noisy little animal, but there is nothing I can do to make it happy.
column3: I pity the poor noisy little animal, but there is nothing I can do to make it happy.

column2: If I could tame it--but that is out of the question; the more I try, the worse I seem to make it.
column3: If I could tame it-but that is out of the question; the more I try, the worse I seem to make it.

column2: It grieves me to the heart to see it in its little storms of sorrow and passion.
column3: It grieves me to the heart to see it in its little storms of sorrow and passion.

column2: I wanted to let it go, but she wouldn't hear of it.
column3: I wanted to let it go, but she wouldn't hear of it.

column2: That seemed cruel and not like her; and yet she may be right.
column3: That seemed cruel and not like her; and yet she may be right.

column2: It might be lonelier than ever; for since I cannot find another one, how could it?
column3: It might be lonelier than ever; for since I cannot find another one, how could it?

column2: Five Months Later
column3: Five Months Later

column2: It is not a kangaroo.
column3: It is not a kangaroo.

column2: No, for it supports itself by holding to her finger, and thus goes a few steps on its hind legs, and then falls down.
column3: No, for it supports itself by holding to her finger, and thus goes a few steps on its hind legs, and then falls down.

column2: It is probably some kind of a bear; and yet it has no tail--as yet--and no fur, except on its head.
column3: It is probably some kind of a bear; and yet it has no tail-as yet-and no fur, except on its head.

column2: It still keeps on growing--that is a curious circumstance, for bears get their growth earlier than this.
column3: It still keeps on growing-that is a curious circumstance, for bears get their growth earlier than this.

column2: Bears are dangerous--since our catastrophe--and I shall not be satisfied to have this one prowling about the place much longer without a muzzle on.
column3: Bears are dangerous-since our catastrophe-and I shall not be satisfied to have this one prowling about the place much longer without a muzzle on.

column2: I have offered to get her a kangaroo if she would let this one go, but it did no good--she is determined to run us into all sorts of foolish risks, I think.
column3: I have offered to get her a kangaroo if she would let this one go, but it did no good-she is determined to run us into all sorts of foolish risks, I think.

column2: She was not like this before she lost her mind.
column3: She was not like this before she lost her mind.

column2: A Fortnight Later
column3: A Fortnight Later

column2: I examined its mouth.
column3: I examined its mouth.

column2: There is no danger yet; it has only one tooth.
column3: There is no danger yet; it has only one tooth.

column2: It has no tail yet.
column3: It has no tail yet.

column2: It makes more noise now than it ever did before--and mainly at night.
column3: It makes more noise now than it ever did before-and mainly at night.

column2: I have moved out.
column3: I have moved out.

column2: But I shall go over, mornings, to breakfast, and to see if it has more teeth. If it gets a mouthful of teeth, it will be time for it to go, tail or no tail, for a bear does not need a tail in order to be dangerous.
column3: But I shall go over, mornings, to breakfast, and to see if it has more teeth. If it gets a mouthful of teeth, it will be time for it to go, tail or no tail, for a bear does not need a tail in order to be dangerous.

column2: Four Months Later
column3: Four Months Later

column2: I have been off hunting and fishing a month, up in the region that she calls Buffalo; I don't know why, unless it is because there are not any buffaloes there.
column3: I have been off hunting and fishing a month, up in the region that she calls Buffalo; I don't know why, unless it is because there are not any buffaloes there.

column2: Meantime the bear has learned to paddle around all by itself on its hind legs, and says "poppa" and "momma."
column3: Meantime the bear has learned to paddle around all by itself on its hind legs, and says "poppa" and "momma."

column2: It is certainly a new species.
column3: It is certainly a new species.

column2: This resemblance to words may be purely accidental, of course, and may have no purpose or meaning; but even in that case it is still extraordinary, and is a thing which no other bear can do.
column3: This resemblance to words may be purely accidental, of course, and may have no purpose or meaning; but even in that case it is still extraordinary, and is a thing which no other bear can do.

column2: This imitation of speech, taken together with general absence of fur and entire absence of tail, sufficiently indicates that this is a new kind of bear.
column3: This imitation of speech, taken together with general absence of fur and entire absence of tail, sufficiently indicates that this is a new kind of bear.

column2: The further study of it will be exceedingly interesting.
column3: The further study of it will be exceedingly interesting.

column2: Meantime I will go off on a far expedition among the forests of the North and make an exhaustive search.
column3: Meantime I will go off on a far expedition among the forests of the North and make an exhaustive search.

column2: There must certainly be another one somewhere, and this one will be less dangerous when it has company of its own species.
column3: There must certainly be another one somewhere, and this one will be less dangerous when it has company of its own species.

column2: I will go straightway; but I will muzzle this one first.
column3: I will go straightway; but I will muzzle this one first.

column2: Three Months Later
column3: Three Months Later

column2: It has been a weary, weary hunt, yet I have had no success.
column3: It has been a weary, weary hunt, yet I have had no success.

column2: In the mean time, without stirring from the home estate, she has caught another one!
column3: In the mean time, without stirring from the home estate, she has caught another one!

column2: I never saw such luck.
column3: I never saw such luck.

column2: I might have hunted these woods a hundred years, I never should have run across that thing.
column3: I might have hunted these woods a hundred years, I never should have run across that thing.

column2: Next Day
column3: Next Day

column2: I have been comparing the new one with the old one, and it is perfectly plain that they are the same breed.
column3: I have been comparing the new one with the old one, and it is perfectly plain that they are the same breed.

column2: I was going to stuff one of them for my collection, but she is prejudiced against it for some reason or other; so I have relinquished the idea, though I think it is a mistake.
column3: I was going to stuff one of them for my collection, but she is prejudiced against it for some reason or other; so I have relinquished the idea, though I think it is a mistake.

column2: It would be an irreparable loss to science if they should get away.
column3: It would be an irreparable loss to science if they should get away.

column2: The old one is tamer than it was, and can laugh and talk like the parrot, having learned this, no doubt, from being with the parrot so much, and having the imitative faculty in a highly developed degree.
column3: The old one is tamer than it was, and can laugh and talk like the parrot, having learned this, no doubt, from being with the parrot so much, and having the imitative faculty in a highly developed degree.

column2: I shall be astonished if it turns out to be a new kind of parrot, and yet I ought not to be astonished, for it has already been everything else it could think of, since those first days when it was a fish.
column3: I shall be astonished if it turns out to be a new kind of parrot, and yet I ought not to be astonished, for it has already been everything else it could think of, since those first days when it was a fish.

column2: The new one is as ugly now as the old one was at first; has the same sulphur-and-raw-meat complexion and the same singular head without any fur on it.
column3: The new one is as ugly now as the old one was at first; has the same sulphur and raw meat complexion and the same singular head without any fur on it.

column2: She calls it Abel.
column3: She calls it Abel.

column2: Ten Years Later
column3: Ten Years Later

column2: They are boys; we found it out long ago.
column3: They are boys; we found it out long ago.

column2: It was their coming in that small, immature shape that puzzled us; we were not used to it. There are some girls now.
column3: It was their coming in that small, immature shape that puzzled us; we were not used to it. There are some girls now.

column2: Abel is a good boy, but if Cain had stayed a bear it would have improved him.
column3: Abel is a good boy, but if Cain had stayed a bear it would have improved him.

column2: After all these years, I see that I was mistaken about Eve in the beginning; it is better to live outside the Garden with her than inside it without her. At first I thought she talked too much; but now I should be sorry to have that voice fall silent and pass out of my life.
column3: After all these years, I see that I was mistaken about Eve in the beginning; it is better to live outside the Garden with her than inside it without her. At first I thought she talked too much; but now I should be sorry to have that voice fall silent and pass out of my life.

column2: Blessed be the chestnut that brought us near together and taught me to know the goodness of her heart and the sweetness of her spirit!
column3: Blessed be the chestnut that brought us near together and taught me to know the goodness of her heart and the sweetness of her spirit!
